title: Identifying AND Probability Statements
text: When we use the word AND in probability, we want two events to occur simultaneously. Here, we want both L and C to be true.

hintAnswer: The person chosen is a Latino California registered voter who prefers life without parole over the death penalty for a person convicted of first degree murder.
title: Identifying AND Probability Statements
text: Which statement best represents the notion that events L and C occur simultaneously?
choices: Given the person chosen is Latino Californian, the person is a registered voter who prefers life in person without parole for a person convicted of first degree murder.
The person chosen is a Latino California registered voter who prefers life without parole over the death penalty for a person convicted of first degree murder.
The person chosen is a Californian registered voter who prefers life in prison without parole over the death penalty for a person convicted of first degree murder or a person is a Latino Californian.
The person is neither Latino Californian nor prefers life in prison without parole over the death penalty for a person convicted of first degree murder.
